New Records: South Africa posted 4-194 on the back of Quinton de Kock's fine knock of 74
Key Match Events: Kagiso Rabada took three vital wickets, including Andries Gous (80 not out) and Harmeet Singh (38)
Quinton de Kock reached his half-century in 26 balls and shared a 110-run partnership with skipper Aiden Markram off 60 deliveries
Rabada returned to dismiss Harmeet, conceding only two runs in the penultimate over
Pre-Game Insights: The US had won the toss and opted to field first, picking up the wicket of Reeza Hendricks early
Post-Match Reflections: Jones said: 'It's hard to take the defeat after getting so close. We could have been a little more disciplined bowling-wise.'
De Kock said: 'We've had some tricky wickets coming up to this game and I think it's just nice to spend some time out in the middle.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa scored freely at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium, posting 4-194
The US fell short, with Andries Gous (80 not out) and Harmeet Singh (38) down the order
Others: The match was played at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium in Antigua
